skill.name: clinical-decision-support
skill.description: Generate professional clinical decision support (CDS) documents for pharmaceutical and clinical research settings, including patient cohort analyses (biomarker-stratified with outcomes) and treatment recommendation reports (evidence-based guidelines with decision algorithms). Supports GRADE evidence grading, statistical analysis (hazard ratios, survival curves, waterfall plots), biomarker integration, and regulatory compliance. Outputs publication-ready LaTeX/PDF format optimized for drug development, clinical research, and evidence synthesis.
skill.summary: Generate professional clinical decision support (CDS) documents for pharmaceutical and clinical rese...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill contains legitimate clinical research tools for generating professional medical documents and statistical analyses. All scripts perform expected scientific computing functions with no malicious behavior detected.

low_findings.title: File system access for legitimate output
low_findings.description: Scripts write analysis results to files in configured output directories. This is expected behavior for a document generation tool.

content.value_statement: Clinical researchers struggle with creating publication-ready documents for biomarker analyses and treatment guidelines. This skill automates the generation of professional clinical decision support documents with statistical analyses and evidence grading.
actual_capabilities: Generate biomarker-stratified patient cohort analyses with statistical comparisons
Create treatment recommendation reports with GRADE evidence grading
Produce Kaplan-Meier survival curves with hazard ratios and confidence intervals
Build clinical decision algorithm flowcharts using TikZ
Validate documents for HIPAA compliance and statistical reporting standards
limitations: Requires de-identified patient data for HIPAA compliance
Statistical analyses assume proper study design and data quality
LaTeX compilation required for PDF output

use_cases.title: Biomarker Stratification Analysis
use_cases.description: Analyze patient cohorts by molecular subtypes with survival outcomes and statistical comparisons for publication

use_cases.title: Treatment Guidelines Development
use_cases.description: Create evidence-based treatment algorithms with GRADE recommendations for clinical practice

use_cases.title: Regulatory Submission Documents
use_cases.description: Generate publication-ready analyses for drug development and regulatory filings

prompt_templates.title: Basic Cohort Analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: Analyze 50 NSCLC patients by PD-L1 expression
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a patient cohort analysis for 50 NSCLC patients stratified by PD-L1 expression (<1%, 1-49%, â‰¥50%). Include ORR, median PFS, and Kaplan-Meier curves comparing the groups.

prompt_templates.title: Treatment Recommendations
prompt_templates.prompt: Create evidence-based treatment recommendations for HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer using GRADE system. Include first, second, and third-line therapies with decision algorithms.

prompt_templates.title: Biomarker Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze a cohort stratified by both PD-L1 and TMB status. Compare outcomes between PD-L1 high/TMB high versus other combinations with forest plots.

prompt_templates.title: Regulatory Document
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a comprehensive biomarker-stratified efficacy analysis for regulatory submission including subgroup analyses, safety by biomarker status, and statistical methodology section.

output_examples.input: Analyze 60 HER2+ breast cancer patients by hormone receptor status
output: â€¢ Executive summary with key efficacy findings in colored boxes
â€¢ Kaplan-Meier curves showing PFS by HR status with hazard ratios
â€¢ Table 1: Patient demographics and baseline characteristics
â€¢ Median PFS: 16.2 vs 22.1 months (HR=0.73, 95% CI 0.54-0.98)
â€¢ Clinical implications with GRADE 1A recommendation

best_practices: Always include proper statistical measures (HR with 95% CI, p-values) for all comparisons
Use the validation script to check documents for completeness and HIPAA compliance before sharing
Include at least one visual schematic using the scientific-schematics skill for treatment algorithms
anti_patterns: Do not include patient identifiers or dates that could violate HIPAA regulations
Avoid making treatment recommendations without proper GRADE evidence grading
Do not skip the executive summary - it's required as the first page of all documents

faq.question: Is this compatible with my existing clinical data formats?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill accepts standard CSV formats with patient IDs, biomarker values, outcomes, and time-to-event data.

faq.question: What are the limits on cohort size?
faq.answer: The skill handles cohorts from 10 to 10,000+ patients. Statistical power calculations are automatically included for small cohorts.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my EMR system?
faq.answer: The skill processes de-identified CSV exports from any EMR system. Ensure HIPAA Safe Harbor de-identification before export.

faq.question: How does the skill ensure data safety?
faq.answer: All validation scripts check for HIPAA identifiers, and the skill only processes de-identified data with no network calls.

faq.question: What if LaTeX compilation fails?
faq.answer: The skill generates both LaTeX source and formatted tables as CSV/PNG backups. Use standard LaTeX editors to debug compilation issues.

faq.question: How does this compare to statistical software like R?
faq.answer: The skill provides publication-ready outputs with proper medical formatting, while R requires extensive formatting. Use both for comprehensive analyses.
